text: Firestopping system submittals include UL/WH system number and approved manufacturer
Sealant, intumescent material, sleeves, putty pads, and backing materials approved per tested system
Installation team trained/certified by manufacturer (Hilti, 3M, STI, etc.)
Storage per manufacturer recommendation (dry, temp controlled)
Substrates clean, free of dust, oil, moisture, or obstructions
Penetrations (MEP, cable trays, ducts) located within tested assembly dimensions
Sleeve/collar/backing/mesh present if required by UL/WH system
Fire caulk fully fills annular space per listed system
Pipe/cable insulated or sheathed per approved tested detail
Intumescent wrap or collar used for plastic/PVC pipe as specified
Label/tag applied indicating UL system, install date, and contractor
Mineral wool/backer rod placed to required depth
Fire-rated caulk applied to achieve required joint movement & rating (e.g., 1- or 2-hour)
System complies with seismic or movement-rated assemblies (e.g., FF-S-0012)

id: E. Curtain Wall & Edge of Slab / Head of Wall

text: Spandrel insulation installed as per fire-resistive rated assembly
Perimeter fire containment system (e.g., Safing insulation + sealant) continuous and sealed
Inspection performed with detailed photo log and UL system verification
All systems labeled or documented in Firestop Register
As-built drawings updated with location and system IDs
Third-party inspection or special inspection completed (if required)
